sentence: Ahead of a presentation at Morgan Stanley Global Consumer and Retail Conference today, The Coca-Cola CompanyKO raised its expectation regarding the negative impact of currency translation on fourth-quarter sales and profits.
Foreign exchange is expected to hurt fourth-quarter sales, operating income and profit-before-tax by 7%, 13% and 11%, higher than previous expectations of 6%, 12% and 10%, respectively.

With more than half of its revenues coming from outside the country, Coca-Cola's profits are being affected by currency headwinds as a result of the recent weakening of many foreign currencies against the U.S. dollar.
However, currency neutral earnings per share (EPS) growth outlook remained unchanged.
Fourth-quarter comparable currency neutral EPS is likely to decline in a mid-to-high single-digit range.
Profits in the upcoming quarter are anticipated to be hurt by six fewer selling days this year and substantially higher marketing expenses.
The stronger U.S. dollar is crushing the value of other currencies, especially those of the emerging countries.
This is largely lowering the value of international sales for companies that are heavily dependent on markets outside the U.S. like Coca-Cola, rival PepsiCo, Inc.
PEP , The Procter & Gamble, Inc. PG and Mondelez International, Inc. MDLZ , to name a few.
The dollar's strength also, in a way, reflects that the U.S. economy is in a healthy state.
The nation's improving economic health is attracting investments, which in turn is increasing the demand for dollar and thus, strengthening it.

As such while all the above mentioned multinational companies are witnessing soft sales in internationally due to currency headwinds, their domestic segments have shown better sales/profits driven by the improving economy.
